task.summary: Default task

Add base API and Gateway projects with essential configurations
Initial setup includes .NET 9.0-based API and Gateway projects, Docker support, and development configurations. Added `.dockerignore`, `Dockerfile`, appsettings, and launchSettings for environment setup. Basic OpenAPI and example endpoints are provided for both services.

Add VCS configuration for Git in .idea project settings
This commit introduces VCS directory mappings in the IDE configuration to use Git for version control. It ensures proper integration with the project's repository.

Rename project to HealthManagement.API and update structure
Renamed the API project to HealthManagement.API across all relevant files and paths for consistency in naming. Adjusted folder structure and project files to align with the new project name. This change improves clarity and better reflects the purpose of the project.

Add auto-generated build and configuration files
This commit includes various auto-generated files for the HealthManagement.API project. These files are produced by the build process and include assembly metadata, project assets, global usings, and other MSBuild configuration files necessary for .NET 9.0 development.

Rename Gateway project to HealthManagement.Gateway
Renamed the Gateway project folder and all related files to align with the new naming convention: HealthManagement.Gateway. Updated paths, project files, and solution references to reflect the change. This improves clarity and consistency across the project structure.

Add HealthManagement.Worker project and configure .NET 9.0
Introduced a new Worker project with HTTP API endpoints and OpenAPI support using .NET 9.0. Updated the solution file to include the Worker, and added configuration files and dependencies for development and deployment.

Add HealthManagement.SERVICE project with .NET 9.0 setup
Introduces a new project, HealthManagement.SERVICE, targeting .NET 9.0. Includes initial configurations such as `appsettings.json`, OpenAPI integration, and default launch settings. A basic WeatherForecast API has been implemented for demonstration purposes.

Add HealthManagement.Infrastructure project with .NET 9.0 setup
This commit introduces a new project, HealthManagement.Infrastructure, to the solution. The project is configured to target .NET 9.0, includes OpenAPI support, and contains basic logging and launch settings for development. A simple WeatherForecast endpoint is also implemented for testing.

Add Services folder to project structure
This change updates the project file to include the Services folder. It ensures a clean structure and prepares the project for future code additions in the Services directory.

Rename Program.cs to Worker.cs for clarity
Renaming the file reflects its actual functionality and purpose. This change improves code readability and maintains consistency with naming conventions.

Refactor structure: rename Infrastructure to DAL.
The HealthManagement.Infrastructure project has been renamed to HealthManagement.DAL to better reflect its purpose. References, folder structures, and solution files have been updated accordingly. This change improves clarity and consistency in project organization.

Add auto-generated build and configuration files for DAL
These files are generated as part of the build process for the HealthManagement.DAL project targeting .NET 9.0. They include assembly metadata, NuGet restore details, MSBuild settings, global using directives, and cache files necessary for the build and dependency management. No manual changes should be made, as these are regenerated automatically.

Add Departament entity to HealthManagement.DAL
Introduces the Departament class with properties for basic details such as Name, Address, Phone, Email, and Notes. It also establishes relationships with HospitalDiagnosisLists and Doctors to support database modeling.

Add Doctor entity to DAL
Introduces the Doctor entity in the data access layer to represent doctors with basic attributes like Name, DateOfBirth, and Contact Info. Includes relationships with Department, PatientDiagnoses, and PatientHistories to establish database connections.

Add EmergencyContact entity to the DAL
Introduce the `EmergencyContact` class in the data access layer to represent emergency contact information. This includes properties for personal details and a relationship with the `Patient` entity.

Add HealthInsurance entity to the data access layer
Introduce the `HealthInsurance` entity with properties for company details. This entity includes a navigation property to manage relationships with `PatientHealthInsurance`. This change lays the groundwork for managing health insurance data.

Update assembly informational version
Updated the AssemblyInformationalVersionAttribute to reflect the new build identifier. This ensures proper version tracking for the assembly. No functional changes were introduced.

Update AssemblyInfoInputs.cache in Debug build outputs
This change impacts the cached assembly info in the Debug folder for .NET 9.0. It ensures that the build reflects the latest configuration or metadata changes.

Remove unused Entities folder from project file
The Entities folder was no longer being used and has been removed from the project file to clean up unused references. This ensures better organization and avoids potential confusion in the project structure.

Add HospitalDiagnosisList entity to DAL
Introduce the `HospitalDiagnosisList` entity in the data access layer to represent hospital and diagnosis-related information. This includes properties for laboratory details, a department relationship, and a list of patient diagnoses to establish necessary data associations.

Add Patient entity to data access layer
Introduced the Patient entity with properties for personal details, relationships, and associated collections. This serves as a foundational model for handling patient-related data in the system.

Add PatientDiagnosis entity to the data access layer
Introduce the PatientDiagnosis entity, establishing relationships with Patient, Doctor, PatientHistory, and HospitalDiagnosisList. This addition lays the groundwork for managing diagnosis data within the application.

Add PatientHealthInsurance entity to the data layer
Introduce the PatientHealthInsurance entity with necessary properties and relationships, including a primary key and a reference to the Patient entity. This addition sets the foundation for managing patient health insurance data in the database.

Add PatientHistory entity to the data access layer
Introduce the PatientHistory entity with necessary properties, relationships, and annotations. This entity links patients, doctors, and diagnoses, supporting visit history tracking in the database.

Add Person entity to the data access layer
Introduced the `Person` entity with properties for ID, name, phone, and address, including data annotations for validation. This will serve as a foundational class for managing personal information in the system. A relationship with the `User` entity was also defined.

Add Role entity to the data access layer
Introduced the Role entity with required properties and relationships to manage roles in the application. This includes RoleId, RoleName, and its association with Users. The entity is annotated for database mapping and schema consistency.

Add User entity to the data access layer
Introduced the User entity with necessary annotations for validation and database mapping. This will serve as a foundational model for user-related operations and relationships, including associations with Role and Person entities.

**Remove obsolete project files and update package dependencies**
Deleted unused IDE-specific files to clean up the repository. Added and updated NuGet package references, including Entity Framework Core and Microsoft.Extensions libraries, to ensure compatibility with net8.0 and net9.0. This improves project organization and dependency management.

Add services, interfaces, and repositories for domain logic
Introduced initial service classes and interfaces for doctors, patients, departments, diagnoses, and insurance. Added corresponding repositories in the data layer. Enhanced DBContext to seed roles for "Doctor" and "Patient".

Implement repository and service layers with base methods
Added repository and service interfaces and their implementations for core entities: Patient, Doctor, Department, and PatientDiagnosis. Updated data entities with necessary properties such as `PatientId` and `DepartmentId`. This commit lays the groundwork for managing these entities with asynchronous operations.

Introduced the `Person` entity with properties for ID, name, phone, and address, including data annotations for validation. This will serve as a foundational class for managing personal information in the system. A relationship with the `User` entity was also defined.

Deleted unused IDE-specific files to clean up the repository. Added and updated NuGet package references, including Entity Framework Core and Microsoft.Extensions libraries, to ensure compatibility with net8.0 and net9.0. This improves project organization and dependency management.

Add DepartmentService class to the service layer
Introduced a new DepartmentService class within the service layer. This serves as the foundation for future department-related business logic and functionality.

Add services, interfaces, and repositories for domain logic
Introduced initial service classes and interfaces for doctors, patients, departments, diagnoses, and insurance. Added corresponding repositories in the data layer. Enhanced DBContext to seed roles for "Doctor" and "Patient".
